Top-3 Scripts:
so_38290929: ssh-keygen -y -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa > ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub

ssh-keygen -y -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa    | \
    sed 's/$/ comment-goes-here/' | \
    tee ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub         | \
    tee -a authorized_keys

Explanations about Options.-t:
Specifies the type of key to create. The possible values are “rsa1” for protocol
 version 1 and “dsa”, “ecdsa”, “ed25519”, or “rsa” for protocol version 2.
Explanations about Options.-f: Specifies the filename of the key file.
Explanations about Options.-y:
This option will read a private OpenSSH format file and print an OpenSSH public key
 to stdout.
